resources.string: Chameleon Mini Live Debugger
Chameleon Logger
GUI and portable logging interface for the Chameleon Mini NFC pentesting boards

Thank you for using and testing this Android application! 

A detailed man page and instructions for using the 
Chameleon Mini Live Debugger (CMLD) are found on 
the project WIKI pages at the next link: 
https://github.com/maxieds/ChameleonMiniLiveDebugger/wiki 

Stay safe out there!

Thank you for your contribution in purchasing the paid 
flavor of the application! 

A detailed man page and instructions for using the 
Chameleon Mini Live Debugger (CMLD) are found on 
the project WIKI pages at the next link: 
https://github.com/maxieds/ChameleonMiniLiveDebugger/wiki 

Stay safe out there!

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, 
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of 
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. 

The developer is not liable for any damages arising in contract 
tort or otherwise from the use or inability to use this software.
An unknown error happened in the application! Please submit a new issue report to let the developer know there is a problem.
Display, edit and search live logging messages and Chameleon terminal command output.
Send, receive and configure settings on the attached Chameleon device.
Import, export and download logs and tag binary dump data.
Run batches of Chameleon commands using the built-in mini scripting language.
Configure settings within the application.

About the CMLD application

This application is copyright (© 2017-2020) and developed in the free time of its author Maxie D. Schmidt (maxieds@gmail.com). For all intensive reasonable non-commercial applications this Android application is free to use and modify under the GPL provided a link to the original project webpage and the author information remain intact in the revisions: maxieds/ChameleonMiniLiveDebugger.

Information about the current build

  • The Android version of the application is build version %%ANDROID_VERSION_CODE%%
  • Android revision %%ANDROID_VERSION_NAME%%
  • Application build flavor %%ANDROID_FLAVOR_NAME%%
  • Git revision %%GIT_COMMIT_HASH%% commited at %%GIT_COMMIT_DATE%%

Documentation and Support

Official documentation for the CMLD application is found on the project WIKI webpage. Though the developer has made a sincere effort to keep most of the user interface and the command buttons self explanatory after some mild tinkering with the Chameleon Mini devices. Testing data, feedback, and future feature requests can all be compiled here in the official issues queue.

Credits

The author thanks users, labs and Chameleon Mini device resalers who have donated time and hardware to helping me keep this CMLD application running at high quality. Donations of Chameleon Mini hardware have been made available to the developer of this application at free or reduced cost by the following contributors and third parties:
  • The KAOS team (Kasper and Oswald) and original proprietors of the Chameleon RevG hardware / firmware (their retail site)
  • The Lab401 team who have customized the Chameleom RevG devices into the Proxgrind revisions (with Bluetooth) and the Tiny variations (their social media profile)
  • The Steve O\'Shea for providing recent bluetooth enabled devices for testing and ensuring forthcoming wireless connection support in the app (Advanced Processing Systems Pte Ltd.)

The pretty freeware icons used by the app were obtained from flaticon.com and their lovely sized transparent PNG enabled conversions of these images to standard sizes. The GIMP image editor on Linux has also been used to create custom icons and colored logos for this application.

User Privacy Policy

A privacy policy for the application is now required and has been posted at the following link for the benefit of users: UserPrivacyPolicy. If you have discovered this app by a search on the Google Play Store, notice that unmodified developer signed binaries are provided by the developer on the project latest releases page on GitHub.
<html><head><style>a { text-decoration: underline; color: %%ABOUTLINKCOLOR%%; font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; }</style></head><body>
</body></html>

Note that all of the different variations of the Chameleon Mini hardware devices do not all support the same commands. The commands supported by the device are programmed into the firmware that must be flashed onto the Chameleon device before you can use it.\n\n In particular, if you try to run a command with this CMLD application, and it fails for some reason, then most likely the device firmware you are using does not support this command. Some commands also require that they be run in a READER mode, whereas some commands must be run while the current active slot on the Chameleon is set to a configuration in SNIFFER mode.

The complete scripting functionality will be added in a future release of the CMLD application. For now there is only this placeholder available. A planned and proposed feature set for this batch or shell script like capability is described at the next project link:
 https://github.com/maxieds/ChameleonMiniLiveDebugger/projects/3

 Planned features include the following:
 • A logger tab like feature to view the script runtime output
 • A gdb debugger like window to view the post execution variable
 values set in the script
A complete list of supported configurations is available from within the Tools | Config Slots tab for each of the slots available on the device.

Enter the APDU component bytes manually into the following box.

 The bytes are in hexadecimal in the following order: 
 [CLA | INS | P1 | P2 | DATA-BYTES]

 Notes on the input data:
 • Note that the LE/LC fields found in wrapped APDUs should not be
 included and will be calculated based on your input later.
 • Bytes specified with 'xx' will be ignored and the previously
 selected values in the assembled APDU bytes are preserved.
